intro: Alternanthera albotomentosa var. ecuadoriensis, commonly known as the white-hairy Alternanthera, is a species native to South America, particularly Ecuador. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are densely covered with fine, white hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. This ornamental plant is often used in water gardens and wetland landscapes due to its aesthetic appeal and adaptability.
